channel.title: Designing for Digital Fabrication on Dan Oved's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Designing for Digital Fabrication on Dan Oved's Blog

item.title: Zoetrope Light and Materials Exploration
item.description: See Part 2 and Part 3 of this project. For our first project for Designing for Digital Fabrication, we are to create something using the laser cutter, with at least some of the geometry generated algebraically. We have two weeks to complete this. Inspiration I searched for inspirations for a project like this and ended up discovering the Zoetrope and being blown away by what people have done with it:

item.title: Designing for Digital Fabrication - Drawing a Real World Object in Vectorworks
item.description: Our first homework assignment for Daniel Rozin’s Designing for Digital Fabrication class was to draw three 2d perspectives of a real world object in Vectorworks. I took this as an opportunity to get the exact dimensions of an object I’ve been eager to to incorporate into a project. At the Armory show in 2015, I discovered and was amazed by the low-resolution work of Jim Campbell. Jim Campbell - Scattered 25X (Marathon)
